Yes, companies can also offer mental health resources in their wellness programs to support employees' emotional well-being. Mental health resources can help employees cope with stress, anxiety, depression, and other mental health conditions that may negatively affect their ability to perform effectively at work.

Companies can provide mental health resources such as confidential counseling services, employee assistance programs, and mental health education and awareness campaigns. In addition, companies can offer flexible work arrangements, reduce work-related stressors, and promote a positive work-life balance to support employees' well-being.

By addressing employees' mental health needs, companies can create a supportive workplace culture, reduce absenteeism and presenteeism, and increase employee engagement and productivity. It can also help to reduce the stigma associated with mental health issues, and send a message to employees that their mental and physical well-being is valued and supported.
